paragraphs.text: Is Afghanistan ready for the drawdown?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: After 13 years of the International Security Assistance Force (ISAF), the United States and a number of its NATO partners will start the Resolute Support Mission in Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The number of NATO and US forces is reduced from 140,000 to 13,500 - most of them American- starting January 1
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: How will the new national unity government in Kabul weather the NATO drawdown, despite a resilient insurgency and intensified fighting?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: There has been much speculation about the security transition in 2014 in Afghanistan
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In 2012, I wrote an Oped for the New York Times, warning that "Kabul risks political meltdown"
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Many other analysts have also predicted a sombre year, particularly after the refusal of former President Hamid Karzai to sign the Bilateral Security Agreement (BSA) with the US
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for the time being, we were all proved wrong as the democratic process that began at the Bonn Conference in 2001, survived
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the country was saved from the brink of a new civil war
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Indeed we have achieved important strategic gains in the last few months, starting with the landmark peaceful transfer of political power from one democratically elected leader to another, for the first time in Afghanistan's history
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This milestone was made possible by the will of ordinary Afghan people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who twice braved the threat of violence imposed by the Taliban and came out en masse, voting for their candidates of choice
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Meanwhile, the Taliban has tried hard to undermine the electoral process
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: By confronting Afghan security forces in 16 different provinces, they wanted to gain significant territory
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: thus declaring themselves as an alternative governing force in the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Nevertheless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the Afghan security forces have been able to hold ground and push back the insurgent offensives in almost all fronts
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which has became a source of pride for the Afghan government and people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This proved wrong skeptics who doubted the capacity of the Afghan security forces to defend their country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which has taken responsibility for security in many provinces since the start of the security transition in 2012
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Following the inauguration of President Ashraf Ghani and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Abdullah Abdullah, the BSA was immediately signed, approved by an overwhelming majority of Afghan Members of Parliament
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: In addition to the BSA, the signing of the Status of Force Agreement (SOFA) between NATO and the new Afghan government has created a new momentum in the country, while ensuring continued military and financial assistance for the new government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This has inherited an economic crisis, characterised by a fiscal gap resulting from the failures of the previous government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Afghanistan's strategic gains are still contingent upon two important factors
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Firstly, there must be continued NATO support for the Afghan security forces
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is done by building the capacity of the forces; providing adequate resources such as fire power and particularly air power; assisting in intelligence gathering; and logistics support
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Without the technical and financial support from the US and NATO countries, the Afghan security forces will not be able to sustain a high rate of casualties against the Taliban
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For instance in 2014, an additional 5,000 members of the Afghan security forces were killed either in direct fighting against the Taliban or because of terrorist attacks such as suicide and road side bombings
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: Secondly, the government has the capacity to reform the security intuitions in order to reduce the level of corruption and eliminate political influence exercised by important power brokers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The financing of the Afghan security forces are beyond the Afghan government's resources and is totally dependent on donors' contribution
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The government could make significant contributions by reducing costs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This could be done through reducing corruption and improving management
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Meanwhile
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: eliminating political influence in appointments of senior officials and promotion of officers could boost the morale of the security forces and increase their fighting capacity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Alas, despite tremendous strategic gains, the new National Unity Afghan government is struggling with key cabinet appointments, particularly in the security sector
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which might have been caused by heavy political influence by power brokers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In fact
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: failures inherited from the previous government such as bad governance, corruption, nepotism and many other symptoms that have caused a growing popular resentment, remain a serious threat to the national unity government
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While people admit that improvements in the security and economic sectors require time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they will not tolerate any failure in fixing a dysfunctional government which has failed to address endemic corruption and a culture of impunity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The inability of the new national unity government to implement a comprehensive reform agenda, could undermine the security transition
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is clear to us in Afghanistan that the donor countries will not tolerate anymore corruption and bad governance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which could weaken their financial commitments pledged during the NATO Summit in Wales
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Any reduction in funding for the Afghan government could negatively impact the Afghan security forces
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: while the Taliban will increase their offensive
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The biggest test for the security transition is ahead of us
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: because the insurgents will further intensify their attacks in the beginning of next spring
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we might see a Taliban surge next summer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Afghan government has little time to prepare itself for the upcoming fighting season
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which has impacted the US and NATO military missions in Afghanistan since 2001
paragraphs.label: assumption
